title: Is it possible to upgrade to 2 RAM? - Quora

response.answer_text: 2 bits of RAM? 2 bytes? 2 kbytes? Maybe - you may be able to find very small RAM chips for supercheap embedded devices. I’d guess the above would have to be custom-ordered, and are probably the most expensive RAM you could buy… Memory | Integrated Circuits (ICs) | DigiKey 2 megs? Now, you’re beginning to find something, although probably not in something useful for “ordinary” PCs. The above link has some smaller RAM sizes… 2 GB? Definitely: 2GB kit (1GBx2) DDR2 PC2-5300 LAPTOP Memory Modules (200-pin SODIMM, 667MHz) Genuine A-Tech Brand at Amazon.com 2 TB? I’ve seen purpose-built huge DB servers with 2TB RAM, but these would need multiple motherboards to hold all the RAM sticks. It appears that the biggest RAM sticks available at the moment are 64GB, so you’d need 32 sticks to get to 2 TB. “Ordinary” desktop (and certainly not laptop) motherboards don’t have this many RAM slots available. Computer Memory | DDR RAM Upgrades | Crucial.com

Depending on the computer system we are talking about. If the system has its ram embedded to motherboard and doesn’t provide any port for upgrading the ram, then you can’t. But it’s a typical system, then it should have port for ram upgrades,in which case you can easily upgrade it.
